channel.title: Help with client
channel.description: Hi im currently on my mac right now and ive seen people make their clients and server work on macs and i wanted to know if anyone knew how?? someone please tell me cause i wanna use my mac

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

wow im confused…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 20, 2009, 06:45:03 pm[/size][hr]can someone please give me a really good tut cause im really really new to macs

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. .bat files don’t run on macs(Unless you’ve got Wine, Boot camp, or Parallels)
  2. Go to Applications -> Utilites -> Terminal.app
  3. cd
  4. javac *.java
  5. java server

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

srry im new to macs i usually use a pc so i go into the client files and open a text editor and add that?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 17, 2009, 03:13:10 pm[/size][hr]ok i typed it into a text editor but when i click run.bat it says to choose an aplication to open it with what do i pick?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with client
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[code]

#!/bin/sh
java -cp server[/code]
Note: server is the main class this might be different.

Type that into a text editor and save it as run.sh

Read full topic
